subject: Re: [junit] Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError
msgSnippet: Jay, ... You re running JDK-1.5-compiled classes inside a 1.4.x virtual machine (49.0 is the version number that 1.5-compiled classes use). You need to
messageBody:
Jay,

> I am working on a Macintosh v10.3.9 with Java 1.4.2 --
> [Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2_09-233)
> Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.2-56, mixed mode)]
>
> Running Junit 4 in Eclipse 3.0.1, I use the "Run as->JUnit Test"
> feature and receive the following exception --
> Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError:
> junit/framework/TestCase (Unsupported major.minor version 49.0)
>
> I've investigated the versions of Java used in the process, and all
> seem to point to the identical SDK.
>
> Does anyone have advice on how to solve this problem? I have not yet
> developed my "java legs" to solve this.

You're running JDK-1.5-compiled classes inside a 1.4.x virtual machine
(49.0 is the version number that 1.5-compiled classes use). You need to
recompile the JUnit 4 classes in a 1.5 SDK, if possible, or upgrade your
VM to 1.5.
